column1: 2024-09-17T17:20:16Z,8530_ds_ef1,Sandstone creek ,LS AI TP VJ,"No GPS track was associated with this survey due to Lucy not having her GPS. The stream had good habitat with several pools. The top of the site was located at the culvert outlet, while the bottom was blocked with a stop net and marked with flagging. The site was divided into three sections for sampling, with fish processed separately and returned to the approximate locations where they were captured.",newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,8530,ds,ef1,6.2,8.1,172,clear,low,,,9,582695,6073848,3.3,4.5,2024-09-17T19:26:06Z,3,5.7,2024-09-17T19:29:17Z,2.2,4.7,2024-09-17T19:33:53Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,30,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_102151.jpg,Net,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_102155.jpg,Above net,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_102137.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,5,2.8,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-09-17T20:32:49Z,8530_us_ef1,Sandstone Creek          ,LS AI TP VJ,"Al's GPS was used to record the track. The stream had a few pools near the top end of the site, which was marked with flagging. Multiple fish were captured, including potential rainbow trout and cutthroat trout hybrids, with numerous photos taken for documentation. Approximately midway through the site, a metal pole structure was present to prevent large woody debris from moving downstream. The stream contained abundant gravels suitable for spawning.",newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,8530,us,ef1,6.2,8.1,172,clear,low,,,9,582746,6073899,2.5,3.8,2024-09-17T22:37:09Z,1.4,5.1,2024-09-17T22:41:34Z,1.5,3.7,2024-09-17T22:42:38Z,1.6,3.2,2024-09-17T22:44:31Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,35,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_154723.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_154444.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_154451.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_154459.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_154504.jpg,Metal poles,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_133553.jpg,Upstream of net ,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_133544.jpg,Net,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_133404.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,4,1.8,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:

","Al‘s GPS use for track. Nice stream with a couple pools near the top end of the site. Top end of site marked with flagging. column10:

","Only Fished the outlet pool of the culvert Because it was full of fish. Nice habitat downstream. Site length was size of pool, roughly 8 m. Pool marked with flagging tape. ",2024-09-18,stream,GPS general,460-600600-11800-47700-0680-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,MORR,00000MORR

column1: 2024-09-18T17:29:15Z,198935_us,Tributary to Knapper Creek ,AI,"The stream was surveyed upstream for ~700 m. The stream exhibited medium-value habitat with a good flow and abundant gravels throughout. A mature mixed forest, including cottonwood, provided excellent bank stabilization, resulting in deeply undercut banks and intermittent pools up to 60 cm deep within the surveyed area. Electrofishing conducted downstream of the crossing captured rainbow trout, cutthroat trout, and Dolly Varden. Upstream sampling captured rainbow trout, cutthroat trout, and cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids. The low-gradient habitat is suitable for cutthroat trout, rainbow trout, and coho juvenile rearing, as well as adfluvial and anadromous spawning. A sizeable beaver dam complex was present at the upper end of the surveyed area, coinciding with the confluence of a tributary mapped in the Freshwater Atlas. There is suspected interconnection between wetlands in this watershed and adjacent watersheds, suggesting the current mapping may misrepresent the watershed's size. This remains unconfirmed, but LiDAR analysis could be used to verify these connections.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198935,us,,4.9,8.2,236,clear,low,,,9,636433,6020756,1.2,2.7,2024-09-18T17:40:17Z,2.2,2.2,2024-09-18T17:39:49Z,2.5,1.1,2024-09-18T17:45:32Z,1.3,3.1,2024-09-18T17:49:05Z,1.8,2.1,2024-09-18T17:54:09Z,1.9,2.6,2024-09-18T17:59:34Z,2.7,3.7,2024-09-18T18:27:29Z,2,2024-09-18T17:39:57Z,3.5,2024-09-18T17:48:17Z,1,2024-09-18T18:11:46Z,,,0.55,2024-09-18T17:35:14Z,0.35,2024-09-18T17:51:34Z,0.28,2024-09-18T17:54:21Z,0.35,2024-09-18T18:05:39Z,0.33,2024-09-18T18:07:44Z,0.55,2024-09-18T18:09:59Z,0.35,2024-09-18T18:28:41Z,0.5,2024-09-18T17:50:23Z,0.4,2024-09-18T17:55:00Z,0.6,2024-09-18T17:59:47Z,,,gravels,fines,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,dominant,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,trace,21-40%,few,evenly distributed,vascular plants,undercut,fines,,mixed forest,mature forest,undercut,fines,,mixed forest,mature forest,,3,riffle-pool,sinuous,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,,700,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_111457.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_110701.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_111510.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_111534.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_111548.jpg,Mature act riparian ,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_113813.jpg,Beaver impoundment top site,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,2.5,1.9,2.2,0.4,0.5,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Medium value habitat. Good size stream with great flow. Abundant gravel throughout and mature mixed forest with cottonwood Terrian has resulted in excellent bank stabilization deeply undercut banks and intermittent pools to 60 cm throughout area surveyed. Fish observed throughout entire area survey. No gradient habitat suitable for cutthroat, rainbow and coho, juvenile rearing as well as adfluvial as well as anadromous spawning.

column1: Sizeable Beaver dam complex at top end of area surveyed, which coincides with entry of tributary and freshwater Atlas mapping. Suspect potential interconnection of wetlands within this watershed and neighbouring watersheds so mapping, as is misrepresent the size of the watershed. This is unconfirmed. LiDAR could be used  to confirm.  ",2024-09-18,stream,GPS general,460-600600-11800-47700-0680-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,MORR,00000MORR

2024-09-18T19:46:37Z,198940_us,Tributary to Knapper Creek ,AI,"The stream was surveyed in the downstream direction, starting at the upstream crossing on Gold Creek FSR, down to this crossing on road/spur HM7504, approximately 340 m. This section of stream provided medium-value habitat, with good flow, abundant gravels for spawning, and suitable rearing areas within undercut banks and occasional deep pools. Evidence of historic beaver activity is present throughout the area surveyed, including one large breached dam near the upstream end of the site. The riparian zone consists of a healthy shrub and herbaceous flood-tolerant plant community. The stream corridor is approximately 40–50 m wide, bordered by mature coniferous forest on both sides.  Electrofishing conducted at the upstream crossing on Gold Creek FSR captured rainbow trout, cutthroat trout, cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids, and Dolly Varden.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198940,us,,4.9,8.2,236,clear,low,,,9,636684,6020931,1.1,3.3,2024-09-18T19:47:22Z,1.6,2.5,2024-09-18T19:55:29Z,0.5,3.6,2024-09-18T20:00:17Z,1.1,1.9,2024-09-18T20:04:08Z,1.9,2.6,2024-09-18T20:07:52Z,1.1,2.6,2024-09-18T20:14:10Z,,,,3,2024-09-18T19:52:48Z,2,2024-09-18T20:05:58Z,3,2024-09-18T20:15:31Z,,,0.21,2024-09-18T19:52:54Z,0.35,,0.4,2024-09-18T20:02:21Z,,,,,,,,,0.3,,0.4,2024-09-18T20:23:42Z,,,,,gravels,fines,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,dominant,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,21-40%,few,evenly distributed,vascular plants,undercut,fines,,shrubs,shrub,sloping,gravels,fines,shrubs,shrub,,4,riffle-pool,sinuous,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,,340,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_132219.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_132222.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_132230.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_132235.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,2.8,1.2,2.7,0.3,0.4,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

","Medium value habitat. This is also the downstream site for the upstream crossing. Good flow, abundant, gravel, and suitable rearing areas within undercut banks and occasional deep pools. column1: 2024-09-18T20:28:30Z,198940_ds,Tributary to Knapper Creek ,AI,"The stream was surveyed in the downstream direction, starting at the upstream crossing on Gold Creek FSR, down to this crossing on road/spur HM7504, and then a further 300m downstream. Downstream of this crossing, the stream had good flow, abundant gravels, and extensive overhanging banks with healthy riparian vegetation, providing suitable rearing habitat for coho, rainbow trout, Dolly Varden, and cutthroat trout. Abundant gravels were also present for spawning. A culvert assessment was completed in 2023, along with a UAV flight survey. The road is failing near the culvert, and the pipe is exceptionally long. It is recommended that the crossing be replaced with an open bottom structure or a streambed simulation design. While this crossing poses more of a concern for fish migration, remediation is still recommended.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198940,ds,,4.9,8.2,236,clear,low,,,9,636911,6021148,1.4,3,2024-09-18T20:38:49Z,1.5,3.1,2024-09-18T20:44:23Z,1.1,3.5,2024-09-18T20:46:54Z,3,4,2024-09-18T20:53:24Z,0.6,2.8,2024-09-18T20:57:57Z,,,,,,,3,2024-09-18T20:47:25Z,4,,3,2024-09-18T21:03:17Z,,,0.5,2024-09-18T20:39:11Z,0.4,2024-09-18T20:40:28Z,0.25,2024-09-18T21:03:48Z,,,,,,,,,0.4,2024-09-18T20:47:40Z,0.4,2024-09-18T21:02:05Z,,,,,gravels,cobbles,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,trace,dominant,trace,sub-dominant,trace,41-70%,few,evenly distributed,mosses,undercut,fines,gravels,mixed forest,mature forest,sloping,gravels,,mixed forest,mature forest,,8,riffle-pool,sinuous,Partially Coupled,frequently confined,,,,,300,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_141258.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_133936.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_141310.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_141318.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,3.3,1.5,3.3,0.4,0.4,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column9:

"," They conducted from Albert outlet in the downstream direction. Very good low. Abundant travels. Abundant overhanging thanks with helping Ryan sure habitat suitable for CO, RB, DV, CT rearing With abundant gravel present for spawning. column1: 2024-09-19T16:54:07Z,195943_ds_ef1,Stock creek ,LS VJ,"This stream flows through agricultural and cattle areas and had very low water levels at the time of assessment, reportedly the lowest observed by local landowners. Electrofishing from 30 m downstream of the culvert up to the outlet pool captured only two fish, fewer than expected given the pool’s size and depth, and the stream’s nice habitat. Conductivity was extremely high, potentially due to cattle activity. The bottom of the site was marked with flagging.",newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,195943,ds,ef1,7.1,7.4,535,clear,low,,,9,645437,6035013,1.2,5.5,2024-09-19T17:26:48Z,2,4.5,2024-09-19T17:28:19Z,3.1,5,2024-09-19T17:30:24Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,359,30,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104713.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104852.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104737.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104742.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104746.jpg,Net,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104831.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_104835.jpg,Electrofisher,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_105146.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,5,2.1,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column9:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Really nice stream that flows through agricultural and cattle area, but very low water at this time of year. Surrounding land owners say this is the lowest water they’ve ever seen. Fished 30 m downstream of the culvert up to the outlet pool, no fish caught except for two in the outlet pool, would have expected to catch more given the big deep outlet pool. Conductivity was extremely high, potentially from cattle use in the area. Bottom of site marked with flagging. ",2024-09-19,stream,GPS general,460-589500-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

column1: 2024-09-19T18:51:56Z,195943_us_ef1,Stock creek ,LS VJ,"The stream appears to have quality habitat at higher flows, but extremely low flows at the time of assessment resulted in few pools suitable for fish. Electrofishing conducted from the culvert on Barrett Station Road upstream ~40 m but yielded no fish, which was unexpected given the habitat. The large outlet drop at the culvert may be inhibiting fish passage, and extremely high conductivity may be impacting fish presence. The top of the site was marked with flagging.",newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,195943,us,ef1,7.1,7.4,535,clear,low,,,9,645443,6035051,1.2,2.1,2024-09-19T18:52:45Z,1.4,2.5,2024-09-19T18:54:06Z,0.9,2.7,2024-09-19T18:55:26Z,2,3,2024-09-19T19:00:03Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,40,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120222.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120354.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120238.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120246.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120250.jpg,Huge tree,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120302.jpg,Net,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_120313.jpg,Electrofisher,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_121052.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,2.6,1.4,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Stream looks nice and would have quality habitat at higher flows, but currently extremely low flows resulted in very few pools suitable for fish. Fished from culvert upstream, roughly 40 m, and caught no fish, which was still surprising given the habitat but Massive outlet drop could also be inhibiting fish. Perhaps extremely high conductivity is affecting fish? Top of site marked with flagging. ",2024-09-19,stream,GPS general,460-589500-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

column1: 2024-09-20T15:34:47Z,203122_us,Simpson Creek,AI,"The stream was surveyed from Nielsen Road downstream to the railway, covering approximately 950 m. The upper 300 m from Nielsen Road has a steeper gradient of 5–6%, characterized by straight riffle-cascade sections with confined, channelized, dyke-like banks. Around 300 m downstream, the gradient decreases to 2–3%, transitioning into a ~50 m section with extensive aggraded material and multiple channels. Below this section, the habitat improves significantly, featuring extensive gravels, deep pools up to 90 cm, large woody debris, and diverse cover. This stream is a major contributor to the greater Kathlyn Creek watershed, with flow volumes during the assessment slightly less than the Kathlyn Creek mainstem. The stream provides high-value habitat upstream, particularly in the upper sections, within this known steelhead, coho, and historically Chinook spawning system. Electrofishing upstream of Nielsen Road captured rainbow trout, while downstream sampling confirmed the presence of Dolly Varden, rainbow trout, cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids, and coho. The coho were captured approximately 350 m downstream of Nielsen Road. The stream is incorrectly mapped in the Freshwater Atlas, located south of the mapped channel.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,203122,us,,6.1,7.7,107,clear,low,,,9,614941,6075220,2.9,6.6,,3.5,5.9,2024-09-20T18:22:31Z,4.2,5,2024-09-20T18:26:23Z,3,6.9,2024-09-20T18:38:32Z,1.3,5.5,2024-09-20T18:47:13Z,6.2,7.3,2024-09-20T19:08:50Z,,,,6,2024-09-20T18:21:12Z,5,,3.5,2024-09-20T18:42:25Z,2,2024-09-20T19:15:05Z,0.6,2024-09-20T19:00:58Z,0.45,2024-09-20T19:04:01Z,0.8,2024-09-20T19:05:37Z,0.4,2024-09-20T19:08:37Z,0.8,2024-09-20T19:10:55Z,,,,,0.7,2024-09-20T18:27:16Z,0.6,2024-09-20T18:45:11Z,0.7,,,,gravels,cobbles,high,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,trace,sub-dominant,dominant,sub-dominant,none,41-70%,few,evenly distributed,none,undercut,fines,gravels,mixed forest,mature forest,undercut,fines,gravels,mixed forest,mature forest,,15,riffle-pool,irregular wandering,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,,950,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_115751.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_115636.jpg,St spawning location ,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,6.2,3.5,4.1,0.6,0.7,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

",Surveyed all the way from Nielsen Road down to the railway. Top 300 m from Nielsen Road down is steeper at five or 6% with predominantly straight riffle cascade confined channelized dyke like banks. At approximately 300 m gradients mellow down to 2 to 3% with an approximately 50 m section containing a lot of a graded material and multiple channels. Downstream of that habitat becomes very high value with extensive areas of gravel deep pools to 90 cm deep large Woody debris and other forms of cover throughout. Area below a graded section is to provide spawning areas for steelhead and historically for chinook according to adjacent land order. ,2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

column1: 2024-09-20T16:23:00Z,58264_ds_ef1,Simpson Creek,LS TP VJ,"The stream was electrofished from a stop net located 25 m downstream of the culvert upstream to the culvert outlet. The outlet pool was too deep to fish entirely, so only the accessible half was safely sampled. The habitat primarily consisted of boulders with frequent pools, providing excellent conditions for fish. A well-developed, mature riparian zone on both sides of the stream offered additional cover and habitat complexity. Bottom of site WP 366.",,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,58264,ds,ef1,6.1,7,88,clear,low,,,9,614296,6074956,3.9,6,,3.2,4.4,,2.8,4.8,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,high,,,,FALSE,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,25,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,5.1,3.3,,,,,,2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

2024-09-20T18:58:00Z,58264_ds_ef2,Simpson Creek,LS TP VJ,"Electrofishing was conducted on a stream section accessed through private property with permission from the landowner. Sampling occurred from WP 367 to WP 368, covering approximately 30 m, with a stop net placed at the downstream end. The site was located ~360 m downstream of the Nielsen Road crossing. The area featured excellent habitat with several deep pools and abundant gravels suitable for spawning. Numerous fish were captured, including coho. The riparian zone on both sides of the stream was healthy and well-developed, providing additional cover and habitat complexity.",,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,58264,ds,ef2,7,6.8,84,clear,low,,,9,614459,6075212,2.3,4.6,,2.5,4.5,,3.2,5.5,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,High,,,,FALSE,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,30,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,4.9,2.7,,,,,,2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

2024-09-20T21:07:00Z,58264_us_ef1,Simpson Creek,LS TP VJ,"The stream was electrofished from the culvert inlet upstream for approximately 35 m, with a stop net placed at the downstream end. The habitat was excellent, featuring undercut banks, numerous pools, and a mature, healthy riparian zone providing ample cover and habitat complexity. The top of the site was marked at WP 369.",,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,58264,us,ef1,6.1,7,88,clear,low,,,9,614278,6074922,4.1,7,,2.9,4.2,,3.4,5.7,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,FALSE,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,32,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,5.6,3.5,,,,,,2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

2024-09-20T21:13:30Z,58245_us,Simpson Creek,AI,"The stream was surveyed from the railway downstream to Lake Kathlyn Road, covering approximately 1 km. The upper 750 m of the stream is in relatively good condition, with mostly intact riparian vegetation, abundant gravels, deep pools, and large woody debris throughout. The lower 250–500 m is heavily impacted by adjacent private lands, with riparian vegetation removal, stream channelization, and bank armouring. Extensive beaver activity was observed within the lower ~300 m, with dams ranging from 0.4 to 1 m in height. An additional crossing was noted on private land just upstream of Lake Kathlyn Road on a driveway. This stream is a major contributor to the greater Kathlyn Creek watershed, with flow volumes during the assessment slightly less than the Kathlyn Creek mainstem. The stream provides high-value habitat upstream, particularly in the upper sections, within this known steelhead, coho, and historically Chinook spawning system. Electrofishing upstream of Nielsen Road captured rainbow trout, while downstream sampling confirmed the presence of Dolly Varden, rainbow trout, cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids, and coho. The coho were captured approximately 350 m downstream of Nielsen Road.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,58245,us,,6.1,7.7,107,clear,moderate,,,9,615378,6075124,2.6,5.1,2024-09-20T21:17:05Z,2.9,5.8,2024-09-20T21:29:11Z,2.9,5.5,2024-09-20T07:42:53Z,4.2,5.4,2024-09-20T07:41:44Z,6,7,2024-09-20T21:42:20Z,7,7,2024-09-20T21:56:43Z,,,,1,2024-09-20T21:19:29Z,1.5,,1.5,,0.5,2024-09-20T21:56:16Z,0.8,2024-09-20T21:27:42Z,0.9,2024-09-20T21:32:40Z,0.6,2024-09-20T21:41:00Z,0.6,,0.55,,,,,,0.9,2024-09-20T21:38:18Z,0.7,2024-09-20T21:45:50Z,1,2024-09-20T21:56:29Z,,,fines,gravels,high,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,dominant,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,21-40%,few,evenly distributed,none,,,,,,,,,,,,12,riffle-pool,irregular wandering,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,,1000,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_154417.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_154429.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_154443.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_154455.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,6,4.3,1.1,0.7,0.9,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Surveyed from railway down to Lake Catherine Road. Stream is in decent shape for first 750 m with primarily intact rep Ryan abundant gravel, deep pools and large wood free throughout the lower 250 to 500 m is heavily influenced by adjacent private lands with removal of ripe and vegetation channelization of the stream and armouring the banks. Extensive beaver activity within the lower 300 m or so with dams ranging from .4 to 1 m in height. Additional crossing on private land just upstream of lake Catherine Road on driveway. High value habitat upstream, particularly in the top sections in this known steelhead coho and historically Chinook spawning system. ",2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

column1: 2024-09-20T22:40:04Z,58245_ds,Simpson Creek,AI,"The stream was surveyed for approximately 70 m from Lake Kathlyn Road to its confluence with Kathlyn Creek. It runs adjacent to the road on one side and private property on the other. Riparian vegetation is minimal on the private property side, with only shrubs present along the roadside. Multiple sections of bank armouring and channelization were observed near private land. Substrate consists primarily of fines and cobble, with only small pockets of gravel. This stream is a major contributor to the greater Kathlyn Creek watershed, with flow volumes during the assessment slightly less than the Kathlyn Creek mainstem. The stream provides high-value habitat upstream, particularly in the upper sections, within this known steelhead, coho, and historically Chinook spawning system. Electrofishing upstream of Nielsen Road captured rainbow trout, while downstream sampling confirmed the presence of Dolly Varden, rainbow trout, cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids, and coho. The coho were captured approximately 350 m downstream of Nielsen Road. ",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,58245,ds,,6.1,7.7,107,clear,moderate,,,9,615431,6075100,4.5,6.1,2024-09-20T22:50:34Z,3.2,5.5,2024-09-20T23:02:56Z,4,7,2024-09-20T23:03:46Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,2,2024-09-20T22:51:42Z,,,,,,,0.3,2024-09-20T22:59:54Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,0.55,2024-09-20T23:00:37Z,0.6,2024-09-20T23:01:33Z,,,,,fines,cobbles,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,trace,trace,dominant,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,21-40%,few,evenly distributed,none,sloping,fines,,shrubs,shrub,undercut,fines,,shrubs,shrub,,16,riffle-pool,sinuous,Decoupled,frequently confined,,,,,70,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_160857.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_160903.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_160915.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_160921.jpg,Kathlyn confluence,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,6.2,3.9,2,0.3,0.6,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

", Surveyed from Lake Kathlyn Road to confluence with Kathlyn Creek. Runs adjacent to the road on one side and adjacent to private property on the other. Very minimal reparian vegetation on private property side with shrubs only on the other side. Multiple areas of bank armouring and appears to be channelized in multiple places adjacent to private land. Some pockets of gravel but primarily fines and cobble.,2024-09-20,stream,GPS general,460-345400-26700-27800-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,BULK,00000BULK

column1: 2024-09-24T22:29:35Z,198106_us,Waterfall Creek ,AI LS,"The stream is slightly constricted by residential yards for the first ~200 m before widening into a more natural channel with healthy shrub and cottonwood riparian vegetation. Abundant gravels are present suitable for Dolly Varden and rainbow trout spawning. Intermittent pools up to 50 cm deep are scattered throughout. A trap and truck operation led by the Chicago Creek Society moves coho from a fence set up near the confluence of Station Creek with the Bulkley River to upstream of Highway 16 on Waterfall Creek annually. Coho from below fence had not yet been transferred into the stream, at the time of assessment.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198106,us,,7,8.1,82,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,590205,6122874,2.7,4.3,2024-09-24T22:30:57Z,2.9,3.5,2024-09-24T22:36:02Z,3.8,4,2024-09-24T22:45:06Z,4,4.2,2024-09-24T22:49:14Z,3.4,4.9,2024-09-24T22:52:59Z,2.9,5,2024-09-24T23:03:47Z,,,,2,2024-09-24T22:31:08Z,1,2024-09-24T22:38:42Z,3,2024-09-24T22:47:32Z,1.5,2024-09-24T22:57:23Z,0.3,2024-09-24T22:38:47Z,0.3,,0.25,2024-09-24T22:43:29Z,0.35,2024-09-24T22:48:54Z,0.25,2024-09-24T22:49:50Z,0.45,2024-09-24T23:03:22Z,,,0.4,2024-09-24T22:38:59Z,0.4,,0.5,2024-09-24T22:53:16Z,,,gravels,fines,high,,,,,moderate,dominant,trace,none,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,41-70%,few,evenly distributed,none,sloping,fines,,mixed forest,mature forest,undercut,fines,,shrubs,shrub,,,riffle-pool,irregular wandering,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,,475,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240924_161249.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240924_161301.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240924_161306.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240924_161315.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,4.3,3.3,1.9,0.3,0.4,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

"," Stream slightly constricted by residential yards for approximately first 200 m then widen to more natural Channell wits with healthy shrub and cottonwood ripe Ryan abundant gravel suitable for and Dolly Vardon and rainbow spawning. Intermittent pools to 50 cm deep throughout. Coho from below fence, not yet transferred into the stream for the year. ",2024-09-24,stream,GPS general,,,00000NA

column1: 2024-09-24T23:39:39Z,198106_ds,Waterfall Creek ,AI,,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198106,ds,,,,,,,,,9,590235,6123162,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-09-25T17:58:39Z,198916_us,Comeau Creek,AI JO,"This survey covers the area from the railway culvert (crossing 198916, ~100m long and from the 1920s) upstream to the crossing on Highway 16 (crossing 198913), spanning approximately 900 m. A separate habitat confirmation was conducted upstream of Highway 16. Therefore, this site encompasses both 198916_us and 198913_ds. A large woody debris jam was observed approximately 250 m upstream of the culvert, creating a 17% gradient over a 9 m section due to a fallen tree. The stream had good flow in this steeper section, supported by a healthy, mature mixed riparian forest that stabilized the banks. Occasional pockets of gravels suitable for coho, Dolly Varden, and cutthroat trout spawning were present.  Electrofishing was conducted and Dolly Varden and cutthroat trout were captured above and below the highway crossing. WP79 markes the confluence with a steel bridge on private land. ",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198916,us,,7.6,8.1,305,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,580450,6115728,2.4,3.5,2024-09-25T18:08:33Z,2.9,4.3,2024-09-25T18:15:27Z,3.6,4.7,2024-09-25T18:19:17Z,4.1,5,2024-09-25T18:51:17Z,,,,,,,,,,4,2024-09-25T18:17:46Z,7,2024-09-25T18:26:02Z,3,2024-09-25T18:36:16Z,3.5,2024-09-25T20:38:42Z,0.3,2024-09-25T18:08:42Z,0.35,2024-09-25T18:21:05Z,0.3,2024-09-25T18:21:09Z,0.25,2024-09-25T18:42:09Z,0.5,2024-09-25T19:02:26Z,0.75,2024-09-25T19:55:32Z,,,0.5,2024-09-25T18:32:15Z,,,,,,,cobbles,boulders,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,trace,sub-dominant,dominant,trace,sub-dominant,none,21-40%,few,clumped,mosses,undercut,fines,,mixed forest,mature forest,V-shaped,fines,cobbles,mixed forest,mature forest,,,cascade-pool,irregular wandering,Partially Coupled,confined,LWD Jam,2,9,,900,2024-09-25T19:00:11Z,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123052.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_125431.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123116.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123121.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,4.4,3.3,4.4,0.4,0.5,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","LWD jam at 250m upstream with 17% gradient for 9m. Tree fell in. Good flow in the steeper system with healthy, mature, mixed riparian, creating stable banks. Occasional pockets of gravel present suitable for spawning coho Dardon and cutthroat. Started at railway culvert from late 1920s that was approximately 100 m long and worked upstream. WP79 is confluence at bridge.",2024-09-25,stream,GPS general,400-415300-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,KISP,00000KISP

column1: 2024-09-25T18:22:54Z,198916_ds,Comeau Creek,LS JD,"The stream was surveyed downstream of the culvert for 300 m, ending at waypoint 378. A large, bent, and unused pipe—possibly a former water intake—ran the entire length of the survey area. The stream contained numerous boulders forming step pools, but high flow at the time of assessment limited the number of pools suitable for fish. Occasional gravels for spawning and frequent large woody debris creating additional steps were observed. The first pool suitable for overwintering fish with adequately reduced flow was located approximately 250 m downstream of the culvert. Electrofishing was conducted and Dolly Varden and cutthroat trout were captured above and below the highway crossing. ",newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,198916,ds,,7.6,8.1,305,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,580299,6116046,3,6,2024-09-25T18:31:09Z,2.3,6.2,2024-09-25T18:35:41Z,4.4,5.2,2024-09-25T18:46:35Z,3.8,6.5,2024-09-25T18:55:21Z,5,6.2,2024-09-25T19:08:58Z,3.9,5.4,2024-09-25T19:19:34Z,,,,5,,3.5,2024-09-25T18:48:18Z,7,2024-09-25T19:13:38Z,5,2024-09-25T19:20:33Z,0.25,2024-09-25T18:43:52Z,0.45,2024-09-25T18:50:03Z,0.35,2024-09-25T18:59:43Z,0.4,2024-09-25T19:03:10Z,0.25,2024-09-25T19:17:57Z,,,,,0.75,2024-09-25T18:31:19Z,0.75,2024-09-25T18:58:58Z,0.8,2024-09-25T19:11:40Z,,,cobbles,gravels,medium,,,,,moderate,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,dominant,trace,trace,sub-dominant,none,21-40%,abundant,evenly distributed,mosses,sloping,cobbles,gravels,shrubs,shrub,V-shaped,gravels,fines,mixed forest,mature forest,,,cascade-pool,sinuous,Partially Coupled,confined,,,,,300,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123540.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123544.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123547.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123552.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123556.jpg,Step,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123604.jpg,Pipe,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123616.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123623.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_123655.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,5.9,3.7,5.1,0.3,0.8,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column10:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Surveyed downstream of culvert for 300 m, Bottom of site wp 378. Large pipe, ran down the entire length of the survey site, perhaps an old water intake. Bent in many places and no longer in use. Really nice dream with lots of boulders, creating step pools, but significant flow during time of survey resulted in very few pools suitable for Fish. occasional gravel present for spawning. Frequent large woody debris, creating steps as well. First pool suitable for overwintering fish with adequate reduced flow found roughly 250 m downstream of the culvert. ",2024-09-25,stream,GPS general,400-415300-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,KISP,00000KISP

column1: 2024-09-25T20:36:25Z,198913_us,Comeau Creek,LS JD,"The stream has frequent pools suitable for overwintering fish, with spawning gravel present despite a significant amount of fines. It has a low gradient near the culvert and flows through agricultural fields, but maintains sufficient riparian cover with large cottonwoods throughout the 600 m survey. A landowner-constructed bridge with two culverts is located ~250 m upstream of the highway crossing. Two ~1 m high logjams are present but remain passable for fish. Electrofishing was conducted and Dolly Varden and cutthroat trout were captured above and below the highway crossing.

,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,198913,us,,7.6,8.1,305,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,581255,6115635,4.6,9.2,2024-09-25T20:43:58Z,5.2,5.6,2024-09-25T20:53:33Z,2.8,5.3,2024-09-25T21:12:49Z,3.1,4.5,2024-09-25T21:24:02Z,4.2,5.4,2024-09-25T21:31:33Z,4.3,6.1,2024-09-25T21:54:03Z,,,,2,2024-09-25T20:52:09Z,3,2024-09-25T21:15:47Z,2,2024-09-25T21:24:39Z,4,2024-09-25T21:37:08Z,0.85,2024-09-25T20:39:09Z,0.4,2024-09-25T21:07:15Z,0.6,2024-09-25T21:20:21Z,,,,,,,,,0.6,2024-09-25T20:45:00Z,0.65,2024-09-25T21:16:49Z,0.45,2024-09-25T21:31:40Z,,,gravels,fines,high,,,,,abundant,sub-dominant,dominant,sub-dominant,trace,sub-dominant,sub-dominant,none,41-70%,abundant,evenly distributed,mosses,sloping,cobbles,gravels,shrubs,shrub,undercut,gravels,fines,mixed forest,mature forest,,,riffle-pool,sinuous,Partially Coupled,frequently confined,,,,,600,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150247.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150253.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150257.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150310.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150318.jpg,Bridge,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150329.jpg,Logjam,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150346.jpg,Logjam,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150413.jpg,Pools ,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240925_150519.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,6,4,2.8,0.6,0.6,<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column9:
>Link to Methods for Site Card

","Nice dream with frequent pools suitable for overwintering fish. Significant amount of fines, but gravel present for spawning. Stream is quite low angle near the culvert and runs through agricultural fields, but sufficient riparian on either side. Lots of big old cottonwoods throughout the length of the survey. Adequate repairing for the length of the survey. Landowners have made a bridge with two culverts underneath at roughly ~250m upstream of the highway crossing. Two logjams at roughly a metre high, but both possible to fish. Surveyed upstream of highway crossing for 600 m. ",2024-09-25,stream,GPS general,400-415300-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,KISP,00000KISP

column1: 2024-09-26T16:47:28Z,198916_ds_ef1,Comeau Creek,AI LS JO JD,"The electrofishing site began at the stop net located approximately 35 m downstream of the culvert and extended upstream to just below the log forming the outlet of the culvert pool. This section was designated as site 198916_ds_ef1. The section above the log to the culvert contained several deeper pools formed by large woody debris, where the majority of fish were captured. This section was designated as a separate sampling site, 198916_ds_ef2, due to its distinct habitat characteristics.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198916,ds,ef1,6.6,8.2,304,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,580405,6115833,3.1,4.1,2024-09-26T18:47:39Z,3.1,4.7,2024-09-26T18:50:15Z,3.2,5.4,2024-09-26T18:53:17Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,34,,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240926_115027.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240926_115037.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,4.7,3.1,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

Electro fishing site is from net location to just below log that is the outlet for the culvert outlet pool. Have broken off the outlet pool and the section approximately 2 m downstream into a separate site as EF two several deeper pools due to large woody debris, where majority of fish were captured.          ",2024-09-26,stream,GPS general,400-415300-00000-00000-0000-0000-000-000-000-000-000-000,KISP,00000KISP

2024-09-26T17:54:02Z,198916_ds_ef2,Comeau Creek,AI LS JO JO,"This site consisted of the culvert outlet pool and approximately 2 m of stream downstream of the outlet pool control. This section featured several deeper pools formed by large woody debris, providing complex habitat where the majority of fish were captured. Electrofishing was conducted simultaneously with the downstream site (198916_ds_ef1) without the use of a separate stop net. The fishing effort for this site was recorded as 100 seconds.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,198916,ds,ef2,6.6,8.2,304,Lightly Turbid,moderate,,,9,580385,6115817,5.5,7.9,2024-09-26T18:27:51Z,7.3,7.8,2024-09-26T18:42:55Z,4.7,5.6,2024-09-26T18:44:23Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,7,,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240926_112601.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240926_112604.jpg,,,,,,,,,,,,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,7.1,5.8,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

column1: 2024-09-27T20:07:53Z,58264_us,Simpson Creek,AI LS JO JD,"The stream was surveyed from Nielsen Road upstream for approximately 650 m, to roughly 200 m upstream of the powerlines. The stream had a steeper gradient with predominantly boulder cover and pockets of gravels suitable for coho, steelhead, and Dolly Varden spawning. Pools were infrequent. The upper end of the site was located just upstream of a short cascade with a 20% gradient. The riparian zone consisted of a healthy, mature mixed forest. This stream is a major contributor to the greater Kathlyn Creek watershed, with flow volumes during the assessment slightly less than the Kathlyn Creek mainstem. The stream provides high-value habitat, particularly below Nielsen Road, as this is a known steelhead, coho, and historically Chinook spawning system. The culvert on Nielsen Road has a significant outlet drop and likely limits fish passage. Electrofishing upstream of Nielsen Road captured rainbow trout, while downstream sampling confirmed the presence of Dolly Varden, rainbow trout, cutthroat trout/rainbow trout hybrids, and coho. The coho were captured approximately 350 m downstream of Nielsen Road.",newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,58264,us,,3.9,7.6,67,clear,moderate,,,9,614272,6074923,4.4,8.6,2024-09-27T20:09:13Z,5.7,10.4,,2.7,7.9,2024-09-27T20:35:26Z,4.1,7.7,2024-09-27T20:42:19Z,6.5,10,2024-09-27T20:49:27Z,,,,,,,7,2024-09-27T20:27:26Z,7,2024-09-27T20:33:52Z,7,2024-09-27T20:37:57Z,8,2024-09-27T20:57:51Z,0.4,2024-09-27T20:20:59Z,0.3,2024-09-27T20:42:30Z,0.25,2024-09-27T20:47:53Z,0.2,2024-09-27T20:54:33Z,0.35,2024-09-27T20:57:45Z,0.25,2024-09-27T21:01:57Z,,,1,2024-09-27T20:27:34Z,0.8,2024-09-27T20:42:51Z,1,2024-09-27T20:59:55Z,,,cobbles,boulders,medium,,,,,moderate,trace,sub-dominant,dominant,trace,trace,trace,none,21-40%,few,clumped,mosses,V-shaped,fines,cobbles,mixed forest,mature forest,sloping,cobbles,boulders,mixed forest,mature forest,,,step-pool,sinuous,Partially Coupled,occasionally confined,cascade or Chute,1.6,8,,615,2024-09-27T21:46:23Z,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_145922.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_145932.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_145942.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_145951.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_145958.jpg,Cascade 8m long,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240927_150021.jpg,recording meter,recording meter,,metre tape,metre tape,clinometer,metre stick,metre stick,pH meter (general),,8.9,4.7,7.3,0.3,0.9,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

",Large drainage with excellent flow. Surveyed from Nielsen Road to approximately 200 m upstream of the powerlines. Steeper system with predominantly boulder cover and pockets of gravel throughout suitable for coho steelhead and Dardon spawning. Few pools occasionally. Top end of sight was just upstream of a short cascade at 20% gradient.
